INTERSHOP IOM 4.6.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision 469e4dc74d5588915135fbfd2d6ef5914befee1c)

Table oms.TransmissionTypeDefDO (Enum)

Transmission types regarding the creation and reception of messages and objects.
The transmission type determines process flows.
Types are for example "SEND_CHECKED_ORDER" for an order that was validated.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id integer PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL  
name varchar(100) UNIQUE, NOT_NULL The name of the transmission type. E.g. "sendCustomerMailDispatch" is used for customer e-mails that are announcing a disptach. 
RoleDefDO roleDefRef integer The role the transmission type is acting as. E.g. "sendCustomerMailDispatch" is attached to the role "Customer". 
description varchar  
messageTypeName varchar  
transmissionTypeName varchar public transmission type name, as used in the transmission REST API. It corresponds to the java enum names.  

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.

Constraints and Indexes 

Type Name Definition
PRIMARY KEY TransmissionTypeDefDO_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id) 
UNIQUE CONSTRAINT TransmissionTypeDefDO_name_uk UNIQUE (name) 
FOREIGN KEY roleDefRefTransmissionTypeDefDO FOREIGN KEY ("roleDefRef") REFERENCES "RoleDefDO"(id)
